content.raw:
I reversed this change in 19b7965 since it broke the build

if we want to change the project name, I think we would need to update all the header files to match since they are currently in `ignition/fuel_tools`

I think it does make more sense as `fuel-tools` though
content.html:
I reversed this change in 19b7965 since it broke the build

if we want to change the project name, I think we would need to update all the header files to match since they are currently in ignition/fuel_tools

I think it does make more sense as fuel-tools though

content.raw: I remember having issues with dashes in the header guards.
content.html: I remember having issues with dashes in the header guards.

content.raw:
as I reflect on this more, we can't use a `-` in the c++ namespace, so it could never be consistent

as it currently stands, the header files match the c++ namespace; the only difference is the package name and generated cmake and pkg-config files. So I'm think I'm fine with the current naming
content.html:
as I reflect on this more, we can't use a - in the c++ namespace, so it could never be consistent

as it currently stands, the header files match the c++ namespace; the only difference is the package name and generated cmake and pkg-config files. So I'm think I'm fine with the current naming

content.raw:
none of the dependencies are exposed in the installed header files, so I marked all the dependencies as `PRIVATE` in 3eef5ad734b2

it also searches for `IgnCURL` instead of `CURL` and links to the target `curl::curl`
content.html:
none of the dependencies are exposed in the installed header files, so I marked all the dependencies as PRIVATE in 3eef5ad734b2

content.raw: I tried to fix pipelines, but something is still broken
content.html: I tried to fix pipelines, but something is still broken

content.raw:
now it's just the examples that are broken; the following should fix it:

~~~
diff -r 6ef703b34bc8 example/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/example/CMakeLists.txt	Fri Jan 12 18:31:51 2018 +0100
+++ b/example/CMakeLists.txt	Fri Jan 12 09:59:00 2018 -0800
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@
 cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 2.8 FATAL_ERROR)
 
 # Find the Ignition Fuel Tools library
-find_package(ignition-fuel-tools0 QUIET REQUIRED)
+find_package(ignition-fuel_tools0 QUIET REQUIRED)
 set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${IGNITION-FUEL-TOOLS_CXX_FLAGS}")
 include_directories(${IGNITION-FUEL-TOOLS_INCLUDE_DIRS})
 link_directories(${IGNITION-FUEL-TOOLS_LIBRARY_DIRS})
~~~
content.html:
now it's just the examples that are broken; the following should fix it:

diff -r 6ef703b34bc8 example/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/example/CMakeLists.txt    Fri Jan 12 18:31:51 2018 +0100
+++ b/example/CMakeLists.txt    Fri Jan 12 09:59:00 2018 -0800
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@
 cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 2.8 FATAL_ERROR)

 # Find the Ignition Fuel Tools library
-find_package(ignition-fuel-tools0 QUIET REQUIRED)
+find_package(ignition-fuel_tools0 QUIET REQUIRED)
 set (CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${IGNITION-FUEL-TOOLS_CXX_FLAGS}")
 include_directories(${IGNITION-FUEL-TOOLS_INCLUDE_DIRS})
 link_directories(${IGNITION-FUEL-TOOLS_LIBRARY_DIRS})

content.raw:
I built and uploaded windows binaries for curl, jsoncpp, and libyaml (with a hack for libyaml) but I had trouble with libzip:

* libzip depends on zlib, so that needs to be compiled too
* libyaml doesn't have an install target (ie. `make install` returns with an error code), so I manually created a zip file with include/yaml.h and the compiled static library
content.html:
I built and uploaded windows binaries for curl, jsoncpp, and libyaml (with a hack for libyaml) but I had trouble with libzip:

  • libzip depends on zlib, so that needs to be compiled too
  • libyaml doesn't have an install target (ie. make install returns with an error code), so I manually created a zip file with include/yaml.h and the compiled static library

content.raw:
I just uploaded libzip. I built zlib, but I had to modify libzip in two places make it compile:

* disable compilation of bzip2 support since bzip2 wasn't found (already done on master, just not in the most recent release https://github.com/nih-at/libzip/commit/84072ae6cc50aa36c00ebb9493e4bb9a45a8bf63)
* disable compilation of regression tests, since they need dlfcn.h

a new jenkins build is queued
content.html:
I just uploaded libzip. I built zlib, but I had to modify libzip in two places make it compile:

  • disable compilation of bzip2 support since bzip2 wasn't found (already done on master, just not in the most recent release https://github.com/nih-at/libzip/commit/84072ae6cc50aa36c00ebb9493e4bb9a45a8bf63)
  • disable compilation of regression tests, since they need dlfcn.h

a new jenkins build is queued
